questions.question: Which property is shown? $3 + 5 = 5 + 3$
questions.hint: The numbers switched places but the sum stays the same. Which property lets you swap the order?

questions.question: Which property is shown? $4 \times 6 = 6 \times 4$
questions.hint: The factors changed order but the product is the same. What property allows this swap?

questions.question: Which property is shown? $(2 + 3) + 4 = 2 + (3 + 4)$
questions.hint: The grouping (parentheses) changed, but the numbers stayed in the same order. Which property is about grouping?

questions.question: Which property is shown? $2 \times (3 + 4) = 2 \times 3 + 2 \times 4$
questions.hint: The 2 was multiplied to each number inside the parentheses. Which property distributes multiplication over addition?

questions.question: Using the commutative property, $7 + 9 = $ ?
questions.hint: The commutative property lets you switch the order of addends. What happens when you swap 7 and 9?

questions.question: Using the commutative property, $5 \times 8 = $ ?
questions.hint: Commutative property means you can change the order. How would you rewrite $5 \times 8$ with swapped factors?

questions.question: Which property is shown? $(5 \times 2) \times 3 = 5 \times (2 \times 3)$
questions.hint: The parentheses moved but the numbers kept their order. Which property is about regrouping?

questions.question: What is $3 \times (4 + 2)$ using the distributive property?
questions.hint: Distribute means to multiply the 3 to each number inside. What do you get when you multiply 3 to both 4 and 2?

questions.question: Which property is shown? $8 + 2 = 2 + 8$
questions.hint: The addends switched positions. Which property lets you change the order without changing the sum?

questions.question: Using the associative property, $(6 + 4) + 5 = $ ?
questions.hint: The associative property changes the grouping but keeps numbers in the same order. Where should the parentheses move?

questions.question: Which property is shown? $9 \times 4 = 4 \times 9$

questions.hint: Only the grouping changed - the numbers are still in the same order. What property deals with regrouping?
